meanings.definition: A channel through which molten metal or plastic is poured into a mold.
meanings.sent1: The sprues in the mold allow the hot metal to flow smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The worker carefully poured the liquid plastic into the sprues of the mold.
meanings.sent3: The sprues in the mold felt like tiny rivers guiding the molten metal.
meanings.sent4: The sprues acted as lifelines, bringing the metal to its final form.
meanings.sent5: The sprues resembled veins carrying life into the mold.

meanings.definition: A small peg or rod used to align parts during assembly.
meanings.sent1: She inserted the sprues to ensure the parts fit perfectly together.
meanings.sent2: The sprues helped keep the pieces in place while assembling the model.
meanings.sent3: The sprues were like little helpers, making sure everything lined up correctly.
meanings.sent4: The sprues were the unsung heroes of the assembly process, holding everything in place.
meanings.sent5: The sprues were like tiny guides, directing each part to its spot.

meanings.definition: Excess material that must be removed from a molded object.
meanings.sent1: After the mold cooled, she trimmed off the sprues to clean up the object.
meanings.sent2: The excess plastic formed sprues that needed to be cut off carefully.
meanings.sent3: The sprues left behind were like little tails on the molded object.
meanings.sent4: Removing the sprues was like sculpting the final shape of the object.
meanings.sent5: The sprues were like unwanted guests that had to be removed from the mold.
